definition: unobstructed passage/to go through unhindered
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
to hinder/to block/to obstruct

sentences.english: Keep streets clear for the passage of  emergency vehicles.
sentences.chinese: 为使救援车辆通行无阻，要保持街道畅通。

sentences.english: If, that plow stays in your hand, land you straight in the Promised Land .
sentences.chinese: 只要犁在手，你就能进到特许之地，通行无阻。

sentences.english: Spectacular Bridge-World's Tallest-Opens Tuesday in France.
sentences.chinese: 法国“世界最高桥梁”即将通行无阻。

sentences.english: They use computers to keep the traffic running smoothly.
sentences.chinese: 他们用计算机控制交通，使车辆通行无阻。

sentences.english: Word up, we gotta get over, straight up and down.
sentences.chinese: 没错，我们必须要克服困难，直到上下通行无阻。

sentences.english: With a rider I've a chance to get through.
sentences.chinese: 有个骑马的人，我才能通行无阻。

definition: to go through/to bore through/to push one's way through
heavily-guarded
to depend on/to rely on
see 寸步難行|寸步难行[cun4 bu4 nan2 xing2]
national border/frontier
as easy as blowing off dust/effortless/with ease
pinyin: bu4 fei4 chui1 hui1 zhi1 li4

definition: act at one's discretion/act as one sees fit
to go on the rampage/to riot/to run amuck
to go on foot (idiom)/to do things at a leisurely pace
to be successful in every endeavor
to suppress rebellion and quell unrest/to bring calm and order to/calm and peaceful/tranquil
major road/thoroughfare/main road
to make sth difficult/to create obstacles
hard to pass
a pass (authority to enter)/a laissez-passer or safe conduct
to exercise sole hegemony (idiom); to dominate a whole area (market, resources etc)/to hold as one's personal fiefdom
